comments:
I just installed the Eclipse runtime base for Callisto RC5. Once installed I proceeded to update manager in order to install WTP. Selecting Web and J2EE Development and then clicking to expand the selection causes an error dialog with the following error to be displayed: "An error has occurred. See error log for more details." The relevant entry from the error log is included below. I also received similar errors while selecting other components in the update manager but this one is easily reproducible.

I've encountered the same error with all of the update sites (with the exception of NODEX Ltd. and tfdn.org, which I was not able to connect to) except the main Callisto update site.

Lawrence, if the error is specific to the Toronto mirror and not eclipse.org you should contact the mirror admin and ask them to force and rsync of the Callisto update site.  I believe the current admin is Yujiang Wang/Toronto/IBM

Actually, I experienced this problem with every mirrored update site. The only update site I didn't have a problem with was the main Callisto update site. The first site I experienced the problem with was the Toronto Lab site. I should have updated the summary once I discovered it was all the sites.
Does anyone know what file specifically seems to be MIA?

I didn't try by starting with M5, specificially, but using mirrors, have not seen this problem. 

From tracing through the stack trace, I'm not sure this is a problem with update sites, per se (unless very indirect). 

On the otherhand, it seems there's little protection from 'null' keys being passed in (even if doc'd as not allowed). 

Perhaps update manger's threads?, and changing timing of response from mirrors? 
expose some null condition not otherwise seen? 

So, I'm passing to Platform UI component for comment.
Moving to Update.

Are you sure this is update problem? 
Doe it still happen?

Created an attachment (id=48307)
Screenshot of expanded Web and J2EE category in update manager

I'm not sure this is a problem in the update component but I get an error dialog while using update manager so this seems like the right place to start.

I just reproduced this problem today using eclipse-SDK-3.2-win32.zip. Here are the specific steps again:
1. Unzip Eclipse into a directory. I used D:\eclipse\test3.2.
2. Launch Eclipse and select Help->Software Updates->Find and Install...
3. Select Search for new features to install and click next.
4. Select the Callisto Discovery Site and click Finish.
5. Select [Canada] Groupe d'utilisateurs do Linux de l'UdeS (http) (although I earlier reproduced this on all sites I didn't retest all site this time) and click OK.
6. Expand Callisto Discovery Site.
7. Select Web and J2EE Tooling.
8. Click to expand Web and J2EE tooling. An error dialog appears. After clicking OK and second error dialog appears. After clicking OK again update manager looks as shown in the attachment.

Same with 3.2.1.

Raising severity since this contributes to user loss. If this would have been my first contact with Eclipse, I would just have shut down this unreliable !@#$% and removed it from my hard drive.
*** Bug 149589 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 138132 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 149359 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Same problem with 3.3M3

I am unable to reproduce this with build i20061205-1200. 

Branko, has this problem been fixed or does it only happen periodically?

It is still a problem in 3.2.1 though and if the fix is simple, then we should consider releasing it to the 3.2.x maintenance stream.

We can see the problem with '[Canada] Groupe d'utilisateurs do Linux de l'UdeS (http)' mirror.

Branko to investigate.

Created an attachment (id=56732)
patch

The problem was that site object never ?remembered? mirror url that was used. This patch fixes this.

Branko, please append a short explanation of the patch - what was the problem and how the patch fixes it (for the benefit of people who will need to aprove it).

McQ, the resulting code is not as elegant as we would have liked, but reworking the loop to make it cleaner would result in a more substantial change. We erred on the side of lesser number of changed lines.

I see what you mean. It looks ok for 3.2.2, but we'll do something cleaner for 3.3?

(+1)

McQ.

I agree.
This patch is optimized for minimum change in delicate loop in ReviewPage of InstallWizard in order to make it as minimally intrusive as possible for 3.2.2. For 3.3 it would be probably the best to rewrite this loop. 
Thanks for approval McQ.

Created bug 170523 to track progress of releasing fix into 3.3.
Closing.
